intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. tinctivaginatus, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with a distinctive saucer-shaped petal, which can reach up to 3 cm in diameter. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with basal leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, and the plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It is often found in shaded areas and is considered a species of conservation interest in some regions.
